再.definition: again; once more; re-; further; beyond this point of time; (before an adjective) more; then (after sth, and not until then); no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis); (used to introduce additional information, as in 再則|再则[zai4ze2], 再就是[zai4jiu4shi4] etc); (literary) to reappear; to reoccur

再三.definition: over and over again; again and again

再保險.definition: reinsurance (contractual device spreading risk between insurers)

再審.definition: to hear a case again; review; retrial

再就是.definition: another one is ...; the other thing is ...

再度.definition: once more; once again; one more time

再拜.definition: to bow again; to bow twice (gesture of respect in former times); (in letters, an expression of respect)

再接再厲.definition: to continue the struggle (idiom); to persist; unremitting efforts

再接再礪.definition: variant of 再接再厲|再接再厉[zai4 jie1 zai4 li4]

再會.definition: to meet again; until we meet again; goodbye

再現.definition: to recreate; to reconstruct (a historical relic)

再生.definition: to be reborn; to regenerate; to be a second so-and-so (famous dead person); recycling; regeneration

再生不良性貧血.pinyin: zai4 sheng1 bu4 liang2 xing4 pin2 xue4

再生父母.definition: like a second parent (idiom); one's great benefactor

再發.definition: to reissue; (of a disease) to recur; (of a patient) to suffer a relapse

再育.definition: to increase; to multiply; to proliferate

再衰三竭.definition: weakening and close to exhaustion (idiom); in terminal decline; on one's last legs

再製.definition: to make more of the same thing; to reproduce; to reprocess; to remanufacture

再說.definition: to say again; to put off a discussion until later; moreover; what's more; besides

再讀.definition: to read again; to review (a lesson etc)

再賽.definition: to compete again (i.e. either have a rematch or, when the scores are tied, have extra time)

再起.definition: to arise again; to make a comeback; resurgence

再造.definition: to give a new lease of life; to reconstruct; to reform; to rework; to recycle; to reproduce (copies, or offspring); restoration; restructuring
